title: Claude Monet Arrival of the Normandy Train Puzzle
description:
Puzzle developed from Claude Monet’s Arrival of the Normandy Train, Gare Saint-Lazare, 1877 from the Art Institute of Chicago’s collection.

Monet chose to focus his attention here on the glass-and-iron train shed, where he found an appealing combination of artificial and natural effects: the rising steam of locomotives trapped within the structure, and daylight penetrating the large, glazed sections of the roof.

Doing jigsaw puzzles is a perfect way for puzzlers of all ages to take a deeper dive into this visual masterpiece by Monet. 

  • Box size: 13 x 10 x 1.875 in.
  • Puzzle size: 27 x 20 in.
  • Materials:  250 gsm matte art paper; high-quality recycled board.
  • Recommended for ages 12 and up.
  • 1000 pieces.
